page.title: 08MEAT PROCESSING,HARTFORD
page.content: The meat has to be pressed into a uniform shape because the supermarkets will only accept a certain shape for the different meats that people who go to the shops want to buy. The meat has to be carved very accurately because there are many different cuts of meat. If the meat was cut in a haphazard manner the different sorts of meat would be mixed, therefore altering the value of the meat. The meat is packaged in plastic bags that have all the air sucked out. This is done on a machine and is called vacuum packing. This kills some of the bacteria in the meat. The rest is killed by keeping the meat cool. The workers wear white coats and hair-nets for hygiene reasons. The meat is then sold to supermarkets all over the country but they do not have an export licence.
